page.title: 01An Overview of the area
page.content: Our area is mainly rural. It contains parts of four villages - Walmer Bridge, Longton, Hesketh Bank, Much Hoole, but most of the land is used for farming. The main form of farming is market gardening. The central part of the area is taken up by marshland.The River Douglas runs south to north in our area and runs into the River Ribble. Our area as a whole is very flat. There is some new industry but this is very light and most of the population commute to work in Preston or Leyland. The population has increased over recent years due to the construction of new housing developments. Our area lies near the main A59 road joining Preston to Liverpool and Southport. There used to be a railway line but this was closed in 1964.
